author: samwilsn
content:
> 2938 has an even lower chance, considering that it is vulnerable to builder DoS vectors that are mitigated by 7560 and 4337 but would be hard to mitigate in 2938

Could you (or anyone) refresh my memory on this DoS? It's been a long time since I've thought about AA üòÖ 

IIRC, 2938 had similar mempool rules to those proposed in 7562 and does separate execution into pre- and post-`PAYGAS` sections.

author: drortirosh
content:
The main issue is that validation and execution are a single transaction. This means that if you accepted 10 transactions into the mempool, the first might invalidate the rest, so you must re-evaluate each transaction after each transaction inclusion.
In addition, the validation logic restrictions (before the PAYGAS opcode) are much more restrictive than 7562, and prevent most use-cases supported by it (storage rules, and paymasters)

author: samwilsn
content: Ah, I see. The suggested mempool rules in 2938 only keep one transaction per account for exactly that reason, which is quite limiting.

author: drortirosh
content: its not even one transaction per account - one account's code might invalidate the validation of the next account...

author: samwilsn
content:
Hm, even with:

> If the execution hits [...] an external call/create that changes the callee to anything but the target or a precompile [exit with failure]

?

author: samwilsn
content: I don't mean to argue though, the rules in 2938 are _extremely_ strict.

author: drortirosh
content:
tx1 validates itself, but its execution (which is unrestricted) modifies the validation of tx2.
so tx1 and tx2 are valid (separately), but once tx1 is executed, tx2 can't be put into the same block.
The major thing we've done in erc7562 with erc4337 is that all validation (under their restrictions) are done before all executions. This way, the unrestricted execution code of all transaction can't invalidate (can cause reverts, of course, but the transactions are all already pre-paid)

author: samwilsn
content: How would tx2 "see" the modifications of tx1 without the balance or call/ext families of instructions?

author: samwilsn
content: Keep in mind that 2938 has the `AA_PREFIX` that prevents normal calls
